I ask for authority to introduoe the attached annualBill, The Bill is usually passed in July or August but thelatest date by which the present Bill must become law is the31st December, 1924, and in the circumstances it may ultimately be decided to postpone discussion of the Bill until after the recess. In view, however, of the recommendations of theSelect Committee of 1922 it is desirable that Parliament shouldbe aware of the contents of the Bill at as earlya date aspossible and I should therefore like to introduce it at once. I ought to draw attention to one point of detail.On 4th June, 1924, the Cabinet decided that the AgriculturalRates Act, 1923, (which expires on 31st iiarch, 1925) should beinserted in the present Bill for the purpose of extending it for a further twelve months. It was subsequently discovered,however, that a Financial Resolution would be necessary tocover the new charge on the Consolidated Fund involved in theextension. The Hinister of Agriculture and Minister ofHealth have therefore thought it best to omit the Act of 1923from the Schedule to the Bill and to promote before 31st liarch,1925, a short extending Bill which would also make provisionfor avoiding the necessity for any Financial Resolution in any ' any future extensions of the Act of 1923.
